27#ifndef MM_INTERNAL_H_INCLUDED_
28#define MM_INTERNAL_H_INCLUDED_
29
30#include <sys/types.h>
31
32#ifdef __cplusplus
33extern "C" {
34#endif
35
36#ifndef EVENT__DISABLE_MM_REPLACEMENT
37/* Internal use only: Memory allocation functions. We give them nice short
38 * mm_names for our own use, but make sure that the symbols have longer names
39 * so they don't conflict with other libraries (like, say, libmm). */
40
41/** Allocate uninitialized memory.
42 *
43 * @return On success, return a pointer to sz newly allocated bytes.
44 * On failure, set errno to ENOMEM and return NULL.
45 * If the argument sz is 0, simply return NULL.
46 */
47void *event_mm_malloc_(size_t sz);
48
49/** Allocate memory initialized to zero.
50 *
51 * @return On success, return a pointer to (count * size) newly allocated
52 * bytes, initialized to zero.
53 * On failure, or if the product would result in an integer overflow,
54 * set errno to ENOMEM and return NULL.
55 * If either arguments are 0, simply return NULL.
56 */
57void *event_mm_calloc_(size_t count, size_t size);
58
59/** Duplicate a string.
60 *
61 * @return On success, return a pointer to a newly allocated duplicate
62 * of a string.
63 * Set errno to ENOMEM and return NULL if a memory allocation error
64 * occurs (or would occur) in the process.
65 * If the argument str is NULL, set errno to EINVAL and return NULL.
66 */
67char *event_mm_strdup_(const char *str);
68
69void *event_mm_realloc_(void *p, size_t sz);
70void event_mm_free_(void *p);
71#define mm_malloc(sz) event_mm_malloc_(sz)
72#define mm_calloc(count, size) event_mm_calloc_((count), (size))
73#define mm_strdup(s) event_mm_strdup_(s)
74#define mm_realloc(p, sz) event_mm_realloc_((p), (sz))
75#define mm_free(p) event_mm_free_(p)
76#else
77#define mm_malloc(sz) malloc(sz)
78#define mm_calloc(n, sz) calloc((n), (sz))
79#define mm_strdup(s) strdup(s)
80#define mm_realloc(p, sz) realloc((p), (sz))
81#define mm_free(p) free(p)
82#endif
83
84#ifdef __cplusplus
85}
86#endif
87
88#endif
89
